Trial_Design.evidence: Sixty patients participated in this randomised double-blinded study.

Intervention.evidence: Thirty patients received lidocaine 1% (lido group) with a 1.5 mg.kg −1 IV bolus in 10 min followed by a 1.5 mg.kg −1 .h −1 IV infusion and other patients received saline (control group).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate whether a continuous intravenous (IV) low-dose lidocaine infusion reduced postoperative pain and modified nociceptive pain threshold after total hip arthroplasty.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Pain scores, morphine consumption, operative hip flexion were recorded over 48 h.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixty patients participated in this randomised double-blinded study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: In comparison with the placebo, lidocaine did not induce any opioid-sparing effect during the first 24 hours (− 2 mg with 95 CI [−5; 9]; p = 0.55).
